course.description_en: Learn to count from 1 to 5 with fun stories and activities. Discover numbers all around us in our daily life.
course.description_ar: تعلم العد من ١ إلى ٥ مع القصص والأنشطة الممتعة. اكتشف الأرقام من حولنا في حياتنا اليومية.
course.subject: math

content_data.title: One Yellow Duck Goes Swimming
content_data.content: Look! Here is ONE yellow duck. The duck is alone. ONE duck swims in the pond. The duck says QUACK! Count with me. ONE duck. Hold up ONE finger. Look around. Can you find ONE toy? Can you find ONE book? ONE is a special number. ONE means just me. ONE means all by myself. When you are alone, you are ONE person. When you have ONE cookie, it is just for you. ONE duck swims happily in the water. She is happy to be ONE special duck.

vocabulary_words.definition: The number 1, means just one thing

content_data.parent_guidance: Hold up one finger clearly when saying 'one'. Point to single objects around the room. Help child find one item of different things. Practice saying 'one' together.
safety_notes: Use large, safe objects for counting
Ensure no small parts that could be choking hazards
Supervise when looking for objects
discussion_questions: How many ducks do you see?
Can you show me one finger?
What is one toy you can find?

extension_activities.title: One Object Hunt
extension_activities.description: Find one book, one cup, one spoon around the house.

extension_activities.title: One Duck Dance
extension_activities.description: Waddle around like one duck saying 'quack quack'.

content_data.title: Two Puppies Play Together
content_data.content: Look! Here are TWO puppies. One puppy is brown. One puppy is white. TWO puppies together! The brown puppy says WOOF! The white puppy says WOOF! TWO woofs! Count with me. ONE puppy, TWO puppies. Hold up TWO fingers. TWO means together. TWO means a pair. You have TWO eyes. You have TWO hands. You have TWO feet. TWO puppies like to play together. They run and jump. TWO is more than one. TWO friends are better than one!
materials_needed: Pairs of objects (two cups, two spoons)
content_data.parent_guidance: Hold up two fingers clearly. Point to child's two eyes, two hands, two feet. Show pairs of objects around the house. Practice counting 'one, two' together.
safety_notes: Use large, safe objects for counting
Make sure child doesn't put small objects in mouth
Supervise when exploring pairs of objects
discussion_questions: How many puppies do you see?
Can you show me two fingers?
What two things can you find that are the same?

extension_activities.title: Find the Pairs
extension_activities.description: Look for two shoes, two socks, two toys that match.
materials: Household objects that come in pairs

extension_activities.title: Two Puppy Play
extension_activities.description: Pretend to be two puppies playing together with a friend or parent.

content_data.title: Three Bears Go for a Walk
content_data.content: Look! Here are THREE little bears. Papa Bear is big. Mama Bear is medium. Baby Bear is small. THREE bears together! Count with me. ONE bear, TWO bears, THREE bears. Hold up THREE fingers. The THREE bears go for a walk. Papa Bear walks first. Mama Bear walks second. Baby Bear walks last. THREE bears see THREE flowers. THREE bears see THREE birds. THREE bears have THREE bowls at home. THREE is more than two. THREE is a fun number!

vocabulary_words.definition: Middle size, not big or small

materials_needed: Three teddy bears or toys (if available)
Three of same objects (three blocks, three cups)
content_data.parent_guidance: Hold up three fingers one at a time while counting. Show groups of three objects. Practice size concepts with big, medium, small objects. Count three things around the house.
safety_notes: Use large toys appropriate for age
Ensure three objects are safe to handle
Supervise when sorting by size
discussion_questions: How many bears are there?
Which bear is the biggest?
Can you find three toys?

extension_activities.title: Three Size Sort
extension_activities.description: Sort objects into big, medium, and small groups.

extension_activities.title: Three Bear Walk
extension_activities.description: Walk around like three bears - big steps, medium steps, small steps.

content_data.title: Four Frogs Jump and Count
content_data.content: Let's count FOUR green frogs! FOUR frogs sit by the pond. Count with me. ONE frog, TWO frogs, THREE frogs, FOUR frogs! Hold up FOUR fingers. Now let's be frogs! Jump like a frog. Hop one time. Hop two times. Hop three times. Hop four times! FOUR is a big number. FOUR is more than three. You have FOUR legs on a chair. You have FOUR wheels on a car. Let's count FOUR hops together! Ready? One hop! Two hops! Three hops! Four hops! Great job counting to FOUR!

vocabulary_words.definition: Round things that help cars move

content_data.parent_guidance: Demonstrate hopping safely. Count out loud with each hop. Show four fingers clearly. Help child count four objects around the house. Keep activity short and fun.
safety_notes: Ensure safe, clear space for hopping
Hold child's hand if needed for balance
Use soft surface for jumping
Take breaks if child gets tired
discussion_questions: How many times did we hop?
Can you show me four fingers?
What has four legs like a chair?

extension_activities.title: Four Object Collection
extension_activities.description: Collect four blocks, four toys, four books.

extension_activities.title: Four Corner Touch
extension_activities.description: Touch four corners of a table or four walls of a room.

content_data.title: Five Bees Visit Five Flowers
content_data.content: Look! Here are FIVE busy bees. Buzz buzz buzz! FIVE yellow bees fly around. Count with me. ONE bee, TWO bees, THREE bees, FOUR bees, FIVE bees! Hold up FIVE fingers. That's your whole hand! The FIVE bees visit FIVE pretty flowers. Each bee finds one flower. FIVE bees work hard. They make honey. FIVE is a big number. FIVE is more than four. You have FIVE fingers on each hand. You have FIVE toes on each foot. FIVE bees fly home happy. Buzz buzz buzz!
materials_needed: Both hands to show five fingers
content_data.parent_guidance: Show five fingers on one hand clearly. Count child's five fingers and five toes. Make buzzing sounds together. Help child count five objects. Emphasize that five is one whole hand.
safety_notes: Use safe objects for counting
Keep bee pictures or toys, no real bees
Count fingers and toes gently
Ensure buzzing sounds are not too loud
discussion_questions: How many bees do you see?
How many fingers on one hand?
What sound do bees make?

extension_activities.title: Five Finger Counting
extension_activities.description: Count five fingers, five toes, five toys.
materials: Child's hands and feet, five toys

extension_activities.title: Buzzing Bee Dance
extension_activities.description: Fly around like five bees making buzzing sounds.

content_data.title: Finding Numbers All Around Us
content_data.content: Let's go on a number hunt! We will find numbers 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 around our house. First, find ONE apple. Next, find TWO shoes. Then, find THREE spoons. Now, find FOUR books. Last, find FIVE toys. Great job! Numbers are everywhere. Count each group out loud. ONE apple for a snack. TWO shoes for your feet. THREE spoons for eating. FOUR books for reading. FIVE toys for playing. You are a great number hunter!
content_data.parent_guidance: Help child find objects safely. Count each group together. Celebrate each successful find. Make it fun like a treasure hunt. Let child touch and arrange objects while counting.
safety_notes: Choose safe, large objects for young children
Supervise when handling kitchen items like spoons
Ensure books are appropriate size
Keep small objects away from toddlers
discussion_questions: Which number is the biggest?
Which group has the most things?
What number comes after 3?

extension_activities.title: Make Number Groups
extension_activities.description: Arrange found objects in neat rows to see the numbers clearly.

extension_activities.title: Number Story Tell
extension_activities.description: Tell a story using the objects found (one apple, two shoes, etc.).

content_data.title: How Well Do You Know Numbers 1-5?
content_data.content: Let's play a fun counting game! I will ask you about numbers. You can use your fingers to help you count!
content_data.parent_guidance: Ask questions slowly and encouragingly. Let child use fingers to count. Celebrate every answer. Help with counting if needed. Keep it positive and fun.
safety_notes: No safety concerns
Keep session positive and encouraging
discussion_questions: Show me one finger. How many is that?
If you have two cookies and eat one, how many do you have left?
Count to three with me. Can you do it alone?
How many wheels does a car have?
Show me all five fingers on one hand. Count them!

extension_activities.title: Number Song
extension_activities.description: Sing a counting song: 'One, two, three, four, five, numbers help us stay alive!'

extension_activities.title: Finger Number Show
extension_activities.description: Hold up fingers for each number while saying it out loud.

content_data.title: Celebrating All Our Numbers 1-5
content_data.content: Let's have a number parade! We will march and count together. First, march and say ONE! Hold up one finger. Next, march and say TWO! Hold up two fingers. Then, march and say THREE! Hold up three fingers. Now, march and say FOUR! Hold up four fingers. Finally, march and say FIVE! Hold up five fingers - your whole hand! You did it! You know all the numbers from 1 to 5. You are a number champion! Let's count together one more time: ONE, TWO, THREE, FOUR, FIVE!

vocabulary_words.definition: Someone who is very good at something

content_data.parent_guidance: March alongside child enthusiastically. Count loudly and clearly together. Celebrate each number with excitement. Make it feel like a real celebration of learning.
safety_notes: Ensure clear, safe space for marching
Keep marching pace appropriate for child
Take breaks if child gets tired
Keep music volume safe for ears
discussion_questions: What's your favorite number from 1 to 5?
Which number is the biggest?
Can you count from 1 to 5 all by yourself?

extension_activities.title: Number Certificate
extension_activities.description: Draw a special certificate showing child knows numbers 1-5.

extension_activities.title: Teach Someone Else
extension_activities.description: Child can teach numbers 1-5 to a sibling, toy, or family member.
